column1: 9.3.2.3.5  Summary of evidence and recommendations for surgical treatment of acquired penile shortness
Penile prosthesis implantation is not effective in increasing penile length.
The evidence for the use of penile disassembly manoeuvres and the sliding technique are limited.

Total phallic reconstruction yields to satisfactory outcomes despite the high incidence of post-
operative complications.

Do not recommend penile prosthesis implantation, penile disassembly or sliding technique 
to patients seeking penile lengthening options.

Use total phallic reconstruction to restore genital anatomy in genetic males with penile 
inadequacy due to traumatic loss.
